answers.answer: It does not sound related to your heart. Advanced diabetes can lead to numbness in the feet. You should get evaluated by your doctor to make sure that you do not have a serious problem.

question: I am a 26 year old male in good health.  Within the last week or so I've had trouble with occasional numbness in my right leg.  Last night, when trying to sit cross-legged, I noticed a swollen area on the top/right side of my right foot.  It is not painful or uncomfortable, even when pressed on.  I have a family history of both heart disease and diabetes and I'm worried this swelling could be somehow related.
title: Numbness in leg/foot and swollen area on foot.
